archiefmat.scope: Berbice 1762-1858. Declarations under oath, testaments, division of estates, inventories of plantations, valuation of estates (prisering), declaration of loans, declarations of guardianship, contracts of selling and buying, procurations, authorisations, cessions, bails (borgtochten), protests of non-acceptation, etcetera, part of which is interesting for multicultural relations. It is usually the secretary of the colony who takes the documents. later on called notary public. Last approximate 30 volumes, from about 1814 onwards, most written in English.
archiefmat.notes: The whole series up to 1858 consists of 127 volumes. Last approximately 30 volumes, from about 1814 onwards, mostly written in English.
